TopicTitle: PAK-FA T-50-2 supermaneuvrable jet with AIM-56B missiles and mk2 bomb bay

Articles.Content:
Product of KATEC Skunkworks. check us out at our thread. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/95779-KATEC-%28Kerbin-s-Advanced-Technology-Collective%29-Precision-works

All stock.

The PAK-FA T-50-2 prototype. It's as maneuverable as my superhornet (minimum of 10 G's), can carry 2070 units of fuel, has a high cruising speed, is powered by two turbofan engines, and has a full sized mk2 bomb bay for stealth strike missions deep into hostile airspace.

This craft also carries two state-of-the-art AIM-56B Block I missiles, which are supermaneuvrable and extremely long range. Block II is under development with an improved warhead.

The cruise missile shown in the bomb bay is still classified and will not be included.

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/vfpw6q6n2dzbuwk/PAK-FA%20T-50-2%20A2A%20PA.craft?dl=0

Wow! Great Job! However, remove the SAS modules. It ruins the look of the craft and try to keep the clipping to a minimum because the new 0.25 wings show part clipping easily.
